forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Showers and thunderstorms before 2am, then rain between 2am and 5am, then a chance of drizzle. Mostly cloudy. Low around 53, with temperatures rising to around 55 overnight. Southwest wind 7 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of drizzle before 11am. Sunny. High near 63, with temperatures falling to around 61 in the afternoon. Northwest wind 7 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.

weather_report:
As the clock quietly ticks past midnight, Downtown San Francisco finds itself in the throes of a gentle tempest. With rain whispering against the windows and the occasional rumble of thunder, the night is enveloped in a blanket of moisture that saturates the air. A chill lingers, hugging the streets and rising from the pavement, while the winds flirt with strength—pushing through the city, ruffling leaves and sending a shiver through passersby. As dawn approaches, the rain will hold its sway until the early morning hours, yielding gradually to a veil of clouds that will cloak the landscape in a soft, gray light.

Come Saturday, the weather reveals a kinder face. Drizzle may make a fleeting appearance before 11 a.m., but as the sun struggles to break free, we can expect moments of clarity and warmth. The gentle embrace of a northwest wind will foster an atmosphere of fresh possibilities, perfect for a leisurely stroll along the waterfront or a visit to one of the many cozy cafes tucked away in the city’s nooks. Dress in layers, as the morning chill will give way to mildness, transforming the day into an inviting canvas of muted sunlight and the city’s vibrant pulse. Whether it’s exploring a local gallery or enjoying a quiet moment with a book amid the soft sounds of the waking street, the day beckons with quiet charm, inviting you to savor the subtle beauty of urban life.
